basics.name: Nick Nisi
basics.label: Staff Software Engineer
basics.summary: With more than 12 years in the industry as a dedicated JavaScript and TypeScript specialist, I actively advocate for community through teaching and enhancing developer tooling. I'm a panelist on the JS Party podcast and I proudly organized Nebraska's sole JavaScript conference.

work.name: Meta
work.description: Global technology company focusing on social networking services and virtual reality.

work.name: C2FO
work.description: A financial technology company that provides working capital solutions to businesses.
work.summary: A tinkering archetype focused on the developer experience and front end tooling.
highlights: Part of the Developer Experience team
Maintainer of design system and react component library using MUI and Storybook
Lead front end chapter meetings to discuss new paradigms and best practices
Lead on project building a complex builder application using multiple state machines
oversaw conversion from react-scripts to vite in the frontend monorepo

work.name: C2FO
work.description: A financial technology company that provides working capital solutions to businesses.
work.summary: Focus on the front end of the money-making product.
highlights: Oversaw and implemented the upgrade of React and TypeScript in a monorepo with more than 70 apps without introducing regressions
Implemented tooling that used AST walking to identify areas of application that were missing internationalization
Maintainer of React component library for internal design system
Full-stack development with TypeScript, implementing GraphQL APIs with NestJS, and consuming them in a React front end

work.name: Sitepen
work.summary: An open source contributor, instructor, and lead developer working with some of the top clients in the world.
highlights: Open Source Contributor, ensuring success on many company and community open source initiatives including Dojo, Intern, TypeDoc, and CodeSandbox
Instructor, teaching 2-5 day workshops online and in-person on topics including TypeScript, JavaScript fundamentals, and Dojo.
Lead Developer, managing teams of up to three developers on successful customer-facing projects for world-class clients including hotels, government agencies, and banks.
Lead Support Engineer, providing timely and thorough answers to technical questions from developers about code, bugs, testing, and architecture.

work.name: Flywheel
work.summary: A developer on the Fly-Tools team
highlights: Developer on the Fly-tools team, delivering tools to internal users to ensure success of a thriving startup and web-hosting company
Introduced TypeScript to the company via the development of a small application for linking support tickets

work.name: C2FO (Pollenware)
work.description: A financial technology startup that provides working capital solutions to businesses.
highlights: Part of core development team delivering results which lead to $9.1 million funding round lead by Union Square Ventures.
Designed and developed frontend architecture on c2fo.com with a focus on the responsive design and using Backbone, RequireJS, Handlebars, and Less to create a friendly single page application.

work.name: Freelancing
highlights: Architected and implemented a proof of concept application for a client utilizing advanced HTML5 and canvas technologies.
Demonstrated the feasibility of using these technologies to make a custom, drag and drop interface that is functional on desktop and iPad/tablet devices.
Utilized Backbone Models and Views to manage rendering and state of shapes and images drawn to a canvas.
Connected to simple REST interface written in Ruby on Rails to save and load state.
Delivered on time and successfully.

work.name: Lockheed Martin
work.position: Software Engineer / Englineering Leadership Development Program
highlights: Accepted into Engineering Leadership Development Program (ELDP) based on job performance, panel interviews, and essays.

Development lead for maintenance drop focusing on performance enhancement and usability, where duties include leading a team of three engineers, supporting builds and turnovers, and cross functional coordination to facilitate the engineering life cycle.

Lead Developer of a system demo application using Flash and driven by XML files which included audio narration, videos, and interactive elements for the customer and met regularly with a customer working group to ensure the demo met their needs.
Chief Architect and lead developer of a metrics reporting web application written in Groovy/Grails that reads data from another application database and generates reports using JasperReports.

publications.name: Componentizing Application State
publications.summary: A talk about treating your application state as a component using React and XState.

publications.name: TalkScript with the TypeScript Team
publications.summary: A live show with the TypeScript team at Microsoft discussing the future of TypeScript.

publications.name: Rules to Git By
publications.summary: An advanced dive into Git and how to use it effectively.

publications.name: No Time for Types
publications.summary: A talk about incrementally adding TypeScript to your JavaScript project.

projects.name: JS Party
projects.description: A weekly celebration of JavaScript and the web.
highlights: Panelist from 2018 through present

projects.name: NebraskaJS
projects.description: A community of JavaScript developers in Nebraska.
highlights: Organized a conference from 2015 through 2019

projects.name: TalkScript
projects.description: A podcast about the TypeScript language and community.
highlights: Interviwed guests from the TypeScript community
Interviewed Anders Hejlsberg, the creator of TypeScript
Interviewed Ryan Dahl, the creator of Node.js and Deno
Interviewed the TypeScript team at Microsoft
Performed live shows at each TypeScript Conf from 2018 through 2022

projects.name: Dojo
projects.description: A modern, reactive framework for building efficient and scalable web applications.
highlights: Contributed to the Dojo 1.x framework and its supporting libraries
Contributed to the Dojo 2+ framework and its supporting libraries
Contributed to the Dojo CLI, including a codemod tool to help with upgrading from Dojo 2 to Dojo 3

projects.name: TypeDoc
projects.description: A documentation generator for TypeScript projects.

projects.name: CodeSandbox
projects.description: An online editor for rapid prototyping and sharing of web applications.
highlights: First outside contributor of new framework support (Dojo).

projects.name: nicknisi dotfiles
projects.description: A collection of configuration files for my development environment.
highlights: Maintainer of a popular dotfiles repository with more than 3,000 stars on GitHub

projects.name: NEJS Conf
projects.description: A conference for JavaScript developers in Nebraska.
highlights: Organized a conference from 2015 through 2019
Speakers from all over the world

projects.name: TypeScript Conf
projects.description: A single day, single track conference highlighting TypeScript and the TypeScript community.
highlights: Emcee from 2018 through present
